title: Evaluate DataFusion-style embedded page indexes (ColumnIndex/OffsetIndex)
description:
## Context
DataFusion and modern Parquet readers use page-level indexes embedded in row group footers:

1. **ColumnIndex** - min/max per page (not just per row group)
2. **OffsetIndex** - byte offsets for each page
3. **Bloom filters** - embedded in row group metadata

Currently ParqueDB uses:
- Row group level min/max (coarser granularity)
- External bloom filter files (indexes/bloom/{ns}.bloom)
- $index_* columns sorted for row group pruning

## Benefits of DataFusion-style
- Single file (no separate index files)
- Page-level pruning (finer than row group)
- Standard Parquet 2.0 format (better ecosystem compatibility)
- Works with any Parquet reader that supports these features

## Considerations
- hyparquet support for ColumnIndex/OffsetIndex
- hyparquet-writer support for writing page indexes
- Migration path from external bloom files
- Performance comparison needed

## Tasks
1. Check hyparquet support for Parquet 2.0 page indexes
2. Benchmark page-level vs row-group-level pruning
3. Decide on migration approach
4. Implement if beneficial

title: Implement SQLite blob flush for events WAL
description:
Flush buffered events to DO SQLite as compressed blobs:

```sql
CREATE TABLE events_wal (
  id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
  batch BLOB,           -- msgpack array of events, up to 2MB
  min_ts INTEGER,
  max_ts INTEGER,
  count INTEGER
);
```

- Serialize events to msgpack/cbor
- Write as single blob row (cost optimization)
- Support reading back for replay

File: src/events/sqlite-wal.ts
close_reason: Implemented SqliteWal class for storing event batches as blobs in SQLite. Features: batch serialization/deserialization, time-range queries, flush management, batch cleanup. Added 18 passing tests.

title: REFACTOR: Add graceful 404 handling for missing parquet files
description:
## Problem
When a parquet file is missing, the worker throws an unhandled exception causing Error 1101 (500).

This should return a proper 404 with a helpful error message instead of crashing.

## Current behavior
```
Error: File not found: onet-graph/occupations.parquet
  at initializeAsyncBuffer (index.js:17951:11)
  at async ParquetReader.read (index.js:18002:25)
  at async QueryExecutor.find (index.js:18704:18)
  at async handleCollectionList (index.js:20477:18)
```

## Expected behavior
```json
{
  "error": true,
  "code": "FILE_NOT_FOUND",
  "message": "Dataset file not found: onet-graph/occupations.parquet",
  "hint": "This dataset may not be uploaded yet. Check R2 bucket contents."
}
```
HTTP Status: 404

## Changes needed
1. Wrap parquet read in try/catch in QueryExecutor.find()
2. Check if file exists before attempting to read
3. Return proper 404 response from dataset handlers
4. Add monitoring/alerting for missing dataset files

## Prevents
- Cryptic 1101 errors for users
- Silent failures that go unnoticed
- Better error messages for debugging

title: Remove hash index infrastructure
description:
Remove the hash index infrastructure since native parquet predicate pushdown on $index_* columns is now faster than secondary indexes.

**UPDATE: Scope expansion required**

Investigation revealed that hash indexes are deeply integrated throughout the codebase. A complete removal requires changes to:

1. **Source files to delete:**
   - src/indexes/secondary/hash.ts (710 lines)
   - src/indexes/secondary/sharded-hash.ts (442 lines)
   - src/indexes/secondary/sst.ts
   - src/indexes/secondary/sharded-sst.ts

2. **Source files to update:**
   - src/indexes/secondary/index.ts (remove hash/sst exports)
   - src/indexes/types.ts (remove 'hash'/'sst' from IndexType)
   - src/indexes/manager.ts (remove hash selection logic, hashLookup, rangeQuery methods)
   - src/worker/IndexCache.ts (remove HashIndex import, loadHashIndex, executeHashLookup, loadSSTIndex, executeSSTLookup)
   - src/worker/QueryExecutor.ts (remove hash/sst cases in executeWithIndex)
   - src/index.ts (remove HashIndex, SSTIndex exports)
   - src/aggregation/executor.ts (remove hash/sst type handling)
   - src/query/executor.ts (remove hash/sst type handling)
   - src/worker/benchmark-queries.ts (extensive hash/sst references)
   - Additional files with 'hash' type references

3. **Test files to delete:**
   - tests/unit/indexes/hash-index.test.ts
   - tests/unit/indexes/sharded-index.test.ts
   - tests/unit/indexes/unique-index.test.ts
   - tests/integration/secondary-index.test.ts

4. **Test files to update:**
   - tests/unit/worker/IndexCache.test.ts
   - tests/unit/error-recovery.test.ts

This is a significant refactoring effort (~2000+ lines of code changes) that should be done carefully to avoid breaking the build. Consider breaking into smaller sub-tasks.
close_reason: Completed: Removed hash index infrastructure. Native parquet predicate pushdown on $index_* columns is now used for equality queries.

title: Benchmark: Node.js to remote R2Backend
close_reason:
Completed R2 remote benchmark from Node.js to Cloudflare R2.

## Benchmark Results

### Test Environment
- Location: Node.js on macOS
- Target: Cloudflare R2 (parquedb bucket)
- Protocol: S3-compatible API via @aws-sdk/client-s3

### Single File Read Latency
| Size | Avg | P50 | P95 |
|------|-----|-----|-----|
| 1KB | 171ms | 171ms | 196ms |
| 64KB | 176ms | 191ms | 227ms |
| 1MB | 232ms | 173ms | 608ms |
| 8MB | 559ms | 508ms | 970ms |

### Range Read Latency (Parquet Row Groups)
| Range | Avg | P50 | P95 |
|-------|-----|-----|-----|
| footer (8 bytes) | 145ms | 118ms | 227ms |
| metadata (4KB) | 125ms | 109ms | 194ms |
| row group 64KB | 140ms | 129ms | 205ms |
| row group 512KB | 157ms | 138ms | 218ms |
| middle 1MB | 258ms | 251ms | 318ms |

### List Operations
| Files | Avg | P50 | P95 |
|-------|-----|-----|-----|
| 10 | 129ms | 129ms | 161ms |
| 50 | 136ms | 124ms | 193ms |
| 100 | 163ms | 125ms | 413ms |

### HEAD Operations
Average: ~121ms (file size independent)

### Concurrent Operations
| Concurrency | Total | Avg/File |
|-------------|-------|----------|
| 5 | 200ms | 40ms |
| 10 | 224ms | 22ms |
| 20 | 250ms | 13ms |

## Key Findings
1. **Base latency**: ~100-120ms for any R2 operation (network RTT)
2. **Throughput scales**: Concurrent reads show near-linear scaling
3. **Range reads efficient**: Small range reads (footer, metadata) add minimal overhead over HEAD
4. **File size impact**: Only significant for files >1MB

## Benchmark File
tests/benchmarks/r2-remote.bench.ts updated with:
- dotenv loading for credentials
- Correct default bucket (parquedb)
- Comprehensive test coverage

Run with: npx vitest bench tests/benchmarks/r2-remote.bench.ts

title: Add runtime validation for JSON parsing

title: Fix R2Backend.append() race condition
description: R2Backend.ts append() reads existing object, concatenates, writes back without locking. Concurrent appends cause lost updates. Use R2 conditional writes (onlyIf: { etagMatches }) and retry.

title: Extract hydration logic in ParqueDB.ts
description: The get() method in ParqueDB.ts (lines 984-1241) contains nearly identical hydration blocks repeated twice for maxInbound and hydrate options. Extract into a private hydrateEntity() method to reduce duplication and bug risk.

title: Update GraphDL/IceType integration for v0.3/v0.2
description: Update integration tests and usage for @graphdl/core@0.3.0, @icetype/core@0.2.0, @icetype/iceberg@0.2.0. Use new unified API.

title: Fix prototype pollution risk in $set operator
description: The $set operator with dot notation in ParqueDB.ts (lines 1410-1430) does not sanitize field names. Paths like '__proto__.polluted' or 'constructor.prototype.x' could lead to prototype pollution. Add validation to exclude reserved object properties.

title: Indexed queries still scan 400K+ rows: row group skip not effective
description: Hash index lookup for titleType=movie returns 400K docIds across all 20 row groups. Since all row groups contain 'movie' entries, no row groups are skipped. The index narrows the candidate set but still reads all rows from targeted row groups. For low-selectivity filters (40% of data), the index adds overhead (352ms lookup) without reducing I/O. Need: (1) investigate if -based filtering within row groups can use pushdown, (2) consider returning early if selectivity is too low, (3) benchmark high-selectivity queries separately.

The codebase mixes strong consistency (Durable Objects) with eventual consistency (R2 reads) without clear documentation. Users need to understand:

1. When reads are strongly consistent vs eventually consistent

3. The CQRS architecture implications
4. How stale data is handled

title: Indexing
description: FTS, vector, bloom filter, and secondary indexes

title: Implement full-text search
description: Inverted index for $text queries

title: Secondary index queries slower than full scans
description:
Benchmark reveals indexed queries are 50-70% SLOWER than equivalent full scans:

Evidence:
- imdb100k-eq-movie: indexed 259ms vs scan 129ms (2x slower)
- imdb100k-eq-tvseries: indexed 538ms vs scan 157ms (3x slower)
- imdb100k-range-year-2020s: indexed 321ms vs scan 192ms (1.7x slower)

Root causes to investigate:
1. Index fetch from R2 adds latency (extra HTTP request)
2. Row group hints don't skip enough data to offset index cost
3. Parquet's native column stats already provide predicate pushdown for * columns
4. Index lookup overhead (parsing, searching) exceeds benefits

Potential solutions:
- Cache index files in memory after first load
- Only use indexes when selectivity is very high (< 1% of rows)
- Consider columnar bloom filters instead of separate index files
- Pre-warm index cache on worker startup
close_reason: Issue resolved - Hash and SST secondary indexes were removed in commits b45ebf0 and 092fa88. Native Parquet predicate pushdown on $index_* columns is now used for equality and range queries, which is faster than the previous secondary index approach. The benchmarks that showed indexed queries being 50-70% slower than full scans led to this architectural change. The codebase now uses: (1) Parquet min/max column statistics for row group skipping, (2) Native bloom filters in Parquet for equality checks, (3) FTS and Vector indexes for specialized search. Equality queries ($eq/$in) and range queries ($gt/$gte/$lt/$lte) now go through the same optimized path.

title: Limit vitest parallelism to prevent OOM
description:
Agents consumed over 100GB RAM running tests. Need to limit vitest parallelism and worker count.

**Solution:**
1. Add to vitest.config.ts:
   - `maxWorkers: 2` or `poolOptions.threads.maxThreads: 2`
   - `minWorkers: 1`
   - `fileParallelism: false` for memory-constrained environments

2. Add CI-specific config:
   - `--no-file-parallelism` flag
   - `--pool=forks --poolOptions.forks.maxForks=2`

3. Consider splitting test suites into smaller batches
close_reason: Added memory limiting config: maxForks=2, fileParallelism=false, maxConcurrency=5

Add: (1) index info to explain() output, (2) a /debug/query-plan endpoint that shows the full execution plan including index selection, (3) indexFallback/indexError to stats when index fails silently.

title: Load all examples with real data
[SECURITY] Replace new Function() with Dynamic Worker Loaders
description:
The src/client/rpc-promise.ts file uses unsafe new Function(params, actualBody) for deserializing mapper functions. This is eval-like behavior that poses security risks.

Replace with Cloudflare Dynamic Worker Loaders (when GA) or implement pre-registered mapper pattern. Research completed: primitives.org.ai ai-evaluate doesn't exist publicly - use Cloudflare sandbox SDK or Worker Loaders.

References:
- https://developers.cloudflare.com/workers/runtime-apis/bindings/worker-loader/
- https://developers.cloudflare.com/sandbox/
notes:
Fixed by implementing secure mapper patterns:

1. Path-Based Mappers - Simple property access (p => p.name) auto-converted to safe path-based mappers
2. Registered Mappers - New registerMapper/getRegisteredMapper API for pre-registered safe functions  
3. Legacy Mode with Strict Validation - Complex functions validated against dangerous patterns
4. All 87 tests pass including new security tests

See commit for full implementation details.

title: Define Event types and schema
description:
Define the core Event interface and schema for the events log:

```typescript
interface Event {
  id: string           // ULID
  ts: number           // timestamp
  op: 'CREATE' | 'UPDATE' | 'DELETE'
  target: string       // 'users:u1' or 'rel:users:u1:authored:posts:p5'
  before?: Variant     // null for CREATE
  after?: Variant      // null for DELETE
  actor?: string
}
```

File: src/events/types.ts

title: RED: Add e2e tests for deployed dataset endpoints
description:
## Problem
Production endpoint /datasets/onet-graph/occupations returns Error 1101 (File not found: onet-graph/occupations.parquet).

The e2e tests don't catch this because they:
1. Only test basic R2/DO operations
2. Only test the root endpoint (/)
3. Never hit /datasets/* endpoints with real data

Unit tests mock the worker so they don't verify data actually exists in R2.

## Red Test Requirements
Add failing e2e tests that:
1. Hit each configured dataset endpoint and verify 200 response
2. Test at least one collection per dataset (onet-graph/occupations, imdb/titles, etc.)
3. Verify response contains actual data (not just valid JSON structure)
4. Test with and without filters
5. Test pagination (limit, skip, cursor)

## Files to modify
- tests/e2e/parquedb.workers.test.ts - add dataset endpoint tests
- OR create new tests/e2e/datasets.test.ts

## Expected Result
Tests should FAIL currently, exposing the production bug.

title: Use safe-regex in ParqueDB.ts matchesOperator
description: The matchesOperator method in ParqueDB.ts creates RegExp directly from user input without using the safe-regex utility. While createSafeRegex exists in src/utils/safe-regex.ts and is used in query/filter.ts, ParqueDB.ts has its own inline implementation that doesn't use it. This creates a ReDoS vulnerability.

title: [RED] Real FsBackend tests
description: Write failing tests for FsBackend that use real Node fs. No mocks. Test CRUD, list, atomic writes.

title: Epic: Real Integration Tests (No Mocks)
description: Replace all mock storage backends with real tests. Tests must exercise actual storage: FsBackend (Node fs), R2Backend (real R2), FsxBackend (Workers), DOSqliteBackend (Durable Objects). Use vitest-pool-workers with remote:true for real bindings.

title: [GREEN] Schema parsing implementation
description: Implement schema parsing to pass tests

title: Implement consistent error handling/logging
description:
Error handling inconsistent across codebase:
- Silent error swallowing in index loading (hash.ts:73, sst.ts:73)
- console.log in production code (11 files)
- No consistent logging strategy

Implement logger interface, add error context, use proper error types.

title: Implement Result<T,E> error handling pattern
Add prototype pollution guards to query/update.ts and Collection.ts
description: query/update.ts setField/unsetField and Collection.ts setNestedValue/deleteNestedValue lack prototype pollution checks (__proto__, constructor, prototype). mutation/operators.ts has validatePath/isUnsafePath - extract to shared utility and apply everywhere.

title: GREEN: Restore/upload missing dataset parquet files to R2
description:
## Problem
Production error: File not found: onet-graph/occupations.parquet

All dataset collections are returning 1101 errors:
- /datasets/onet-graph/occupations
- /datasets/imdb/titles  
- /datasets/unspsc/segments

The parquet files are either:
1. Never uploaded to R2
2. Accidentally deleted
3. In wrong bucket/path

## Investigation needed
1. Check R2 bucket contents - what files exist?
2. Check deployment history - when did files disappear?
3. Check data pipeline - is there a script to generate/upload these?
4. Check if data exists locally that needs uploading

## Files involved
- src/worker/datasets.ts - dataset config expects files at {prefix}/{collection}.parquet
- R2 bucket: needs onet-graph/occupations.parquet, imdb/titles.parquet, etc.

## Acceptance criteria
- All configured datasets have their parquet files in R2
- /datasets/onet-graph/occupations returns 200 with data
- /datasets/imdb/titles returns 200 with data
- E2e tests from RED issue pass
close_reason: Restored onet-graph and unspsc datasets to R2. onet-graph 4/4 and unspsc 4/4 collections working. imdb 2/5 working (sample data). Remaining issues: imdb ratings/principals/crew, onet-optimized, wikidata need separate tickets.

title: Add stricter typing to aggregation executor
description: aggregation/executor.ts uses 'as any' cast and loose type guards with Record<string, unknown>. Use discriminated unions or branded types for aggregation operators.

title: Fix 6 event sourcing test failures
description: 6 tests failing in event sourcing edge cases: version tracking in events, rapid sequential update ordering, relationship change event ordering. These block 1.0 release. Run npm test to identify and fix.

title: Add tests for query/bloom.ts integration
description: src/query/bloom.ts (612 lines) handles bloom filter query planning and row group pruning but has no dedicated tests. The BloomFilter data structure is tested but the query-level integration is not.

title: Add ParqueDBDO unit tests
description: ParqueDBDO.ts is only tested through e2e tests. Create unit tests independent of full Worker environment to test: SQLite schema initialization, entity CRUD operations, event logging, flush pipeline, optimistic concurrency.
close_reason: Created comprehensive unit tests for ParqueDBDO covering: SQLite schema initialization, Entity CRUD operations, Event logging, Optimistic concurrency, and Relationship operations (link/unlink)

title: [GREEN] Populate implementation
description: Implement populate to pass tests

title: Implement update operators
description: MongoDB-style update operators ($set, $inc, $push, etc.)

title: Fix phantom generics on Entity<TData> - TData is unused
description: Entity<TData>, CreateInput<T>, FindOptions<T> declare generic params that are never used in the interface body due to [key: string]: unknown index signature. Entity<Post> provides no more type safety than Entity<any>. Either put data under a data: TData property or remove phantom generics.

title: [FEATURE] Enforce schema validation at runtime
description:
Schema inference exists in src/schema/parser.ts but validation is not enforced. Need to:

1. Add validateOnWrite option to Collection
2. Implement runtime validation against inferred/declared schema
3. Add schema evolution/migration support
4. Consider strict vs permissive modes
5. Add helpful error messages for validation failures

title: Fix in-place entity mutation in ParqueDBImpl.update()
description: ParqueDB/core.ts update() mutates entity objects directly in the shared entities Map. Concurrent async updates will overwrite each other (lost update). Clone entity before mutation like query/update.ts does.

title: Upload missing IMDB collections (ratings, principals, crew)
description:
The imdb dataset has 5 collections but only 2 have data uploaded:
- titles 
- names 
- ratings  missing
- principals  missing
- crew  missing

Need to generate sample data or source real IMDB data for these collections.

The sample data generator (scripts/generate-imdb-sample.ts) creates titles, people, cast but
the dataset config expects different collection names.

Either:
1. Update dataset config to match what generator produces
2. Update generator to produce expected collections
3. Source real IMDB data and upload

title: [RED] IMDB example using ParqueDB
description: Rewrite IMDB loader to use db.collection().createMany() and $link for relationships. Movies, actors, ratings with proper relationships.

title: [REFACTOR] FTS optimization
description: Optimize tokenization and BM25 scoring

title: [RED] Bloom filter tests
description: Write failing tests for bloom filter creation and lookup

title: Split ParqueDB.ts into smaller modules
description: ParqueDB.ts is 2000+ lines containing multiple classes, validation, filter matching, events, snapshots, relationships. Split into: src/ParqueDB/core.ts, src/ParqueDB/validation.ts, src/ParqueDB/relationships.ts, src/ParqueDB/snapshots.ts
close_reason: Split into 6 modules: core.ts, collection.ts, types.ts, validation.ts, store.ts, index.ts. All 5062 tests pass.

title: [REFACTOR] Collection class cleanup
description: Refactor Collection class

title: Fix null as unknown as Record pattern in migrations
description: Migration files (mongodb.ts:697,718, csv.ts:474, json.ts:478,494,596) use 'null as unknown as Record<string,unknown>' pattern. Replace with proper optional types or undefined.

title: Add performance benchmarks
description: No published benchmarks to back efficiency claims. Create benchmarks comparing: compression ratios vs JSON/SQLite, query latency by data size, storage costs, predicate pushdown effectiveness.

title: [TEST] Add E2E tests to CI pipeline
description:
E2E tests exist in scripts/e2e-benchmark.mjs but are not run in CI. Need to:

1. Add GitHub Actions workflow for E2E tests
2. Configure test environment (Wrangler dev or miniflare)
3. Add E2E test badge to README
4. Consider nightly E2E runs against deployed worker

title: Replace Buffer.from with Worker-safe encoding
description: QueryExecutor.ts line 1618 uses Buffer.from() for cursor encoding. Buffer is Node.js global - Workers support it but prefer btoa() or Uint8Array for proper edge compatibility.

title: [ARCH] Address async-and-forget write semantics
description:
Some write operations don't await completion, leading to:
- Fire-and-forget patterns that may lose data
- No confirmation that writes succeeded
- Potential for silent failures

Audit all write paths and ensure proper await/error handling. Consider adding write acknowledgment options.

title: Add concurrency tests
description: No tests for parallel operations on same entities. Add tests for: concurrent reads, concurrent writes, read-write races, optimistic locking under contention.

title: Add tests for vector index components
description: Missing test coverage for: hnsw.ts (HNSW index), distance.ts (vector distance calculations). Vector search is a key feature that needs test coverage.

title: [REFACTOR] Filter evaluation cleanup
description: Refactor filter evaluation for performance

title: [GREEN] Link/unlink implementation
description: Implement $link and $unlink to pass tests

title: Add graph traversal tests
description: src/relationships/traverse.ts has limited test coverage for complex graph queries. Add tests for: multi-hop traversal, cycle detection, path finding, breadth-first vs depth-first traversal.

title: Set up CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions
description:
No CI/CD pipeline detected. Create .github/workflows/ with:
- test:unit (15 second target)
- test:integration (30 second target)
- test:e2e (60 second target)
- lint and type check
- Performance regression detection
- Coverage reporting

title: [TEST] Enforce code coverage thresholds
description:
Add code coverage enforcement to CI:

1. Configure vitest/jest coverage reporting
2. Set minimum thresholds (suggest 80% line, 70% branch)
3. Add coverage badge to README
4. Fail CI if coverage drops below threshold
5. Generate coverage reports as artifacts

title: Implement Event writer with memory buffer
description:
Create EventWriter class that buffers events in memory before flushing:

- Buffer events in memory
- Configurable flush triggers (size threshold, time interval, explicit flush)
- Track min/max timestamps for the buffer
- Emit batches to flush handlers

File: src/events/writer.ts
close_reason: Implemented EventWriter class with memory buffering, configurable thresholds (size, count, time), flush handlers, statistics tracking, and timed auto-flush. Added 19 passing tests.
